The TFPC fluctuations increased and model measurement correspondences became tighter after approximately 1971, indicating a more significant climate contribution during this period. Specifying 0 since the fluctuations were around the zero mark.
Model 1 explains almost 50% of the total TFPC variance from 1951 to 1980.
Model 2 represents around 70% of variance from 1981 to 2010, suggesting agricultural productivity has become more sensitive to climate in recent years.
Calculated as compound annual growth rates from 2010 to 2040.  75% of models project a TFP drop off to pre-1980s levels by 2040.
